item.title: My first paper is officially published!
item.description:
üëèüéä I’m thrilled to announce that my first research paper “rtestim: Time-varying reproduction number estimation using trend filtering” has just been officially released! üìä

üîç This work proposed a method, which is implemented in the R package rtestim, for accurate and computationally efficient estimation of the instantaneous reproduction number, a crucial metric for understanding the spread of infectious diseases.

You can read the full paper here.

I’m incredibly proud of this work and would love to hear your thoughts and feedback. A big thank you to my collaborators and everyone who supported me throughout this journey! üôèüåü

item.title: Application of nonparametric regression for Infectious diseases
I'm Now an ACE Certified Personal Trainer!
item.description:
üéâ I‚Äôm thrilled to share that I‚Äôve officially passed the ACE CPT exam on August 08, 2024 and am now a certified personal trainer! Check out my certificate here!üèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüí™

This journey has been filled with hard work, dedication, and countless hours of study. I‚Äôm incredibly grateful for all the support and encouragement I‚Äôve received from friends, family, and mentors along the way.

Becoming a certified personal trainer is a dream come true, and I‚Äôm excited to start this new chapter. I‚Äôm passionate about helping others achieve their fitness goals and live healthier, happier lives. Whether you’re just starting out or looking to take your fitness to the next level, I‚Äôm here to support you every step of the way.

item.title: Machine Learning in Record Linkage
item.description: Project with Methodology Department, Statistics Canada

item.title: Hello! ü••
item.description:
About Me

I’m currently a PhD candidate in Statistics working with Dr. Daniel J. McDonald at the University of British Columbia. My research areas are computational statistics, nonparametric regression, and convex optimization. I started doing the PhD program in September, 2020 and became a PhD candidate on June 13, 2023. Before this, I did my master in statistics with Dr. Maia Fraser at the University of Ottawa during 2018–2020. I did my undergraduate in Economic Statistics at Zhejiang University of Finance and Economics, Zhejiang, China between 2014 and 2018.
